akn:section.akn:heading: Special rules for disability retirement and death-in-service benefits with respect to certain employ

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Officers and employees to whom section 2051 rules apply

akn:content.akn:p: (a) Officers and employees to whom section 2051 rules apply Notwithstanding any other provision of law, an officer or employee of the Central Intelligence Agency subject to retirement system coverage under subchapter III of chapter 83 of title 5 who— shall, upon his own application or upon order of the Director, be retired on an annuity computed in accordance with the rules prescribed in section 2051 of this title, in lieu of an annuity computed as provided by section 8337 of title 5.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Survivors of officers and employees to whom section 2052 rules apply

akn:content.akn:p: (b) Survivors of officers and employees to whom section 2052 rules apply Notwithstanding any other provision of law, in the case of an officer or employee of the Central Intelligence Agency subject to retirement system coverage under subchapter III of chapter 83, title 5, who— such surviving spouse, former spouse, or child of such officer or employee shall be entitled to an annuity computed in accordance with section 2052 of this title, in lieu of an annuity computed in accordance with section 8341 of title 5.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Annuities under this section deemed annuities under chapter 83 of title 5

akn:content.akn:p: (c) Annuities under this section deemed annuities under chapter 83 of title 5 The annuities provided under subsections (a) and (b) of this section shall be deemed to be annuities under chapter 83 of title 5 for purposes of the other provisions of such chapter and other laws (including title 26) relating to such annuities, and shall be payable from the Central Intelligence Agency Retirement and Disability Fund maintained pursuant to section 2012 of this title.
